etymology.description: 样板 + 间 = model/sample + room → model room/showroom.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to a fully furnished model room or apartment set up to display layout, finishes, and style for prospective buyers. Common in real-estate sales centers and furniture displays.
etymology.simplification: PRC character simplification for high‑frequency characters to reduce strokes and speed writing: 樣→样, 間→间; 板 unchanged.

parts.english: room; space; between; classifier for rooms

examples.chinese: 我们去样板间看户型和装修(我們去樣板間看戶型和裝修)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qù yàngbǎnjiān kàn hùxíng hé zhuāngxiū.
examples.english: We went to the showroom to look at the layout and finishes.

examples.chinese: 房地产公司用样板间展示风格和材料(房地產公司用樣板間展示風格和材料)。
examples.pinyin: Fángdìchǎn gōngsī yòng yàngbǎnjiān zhǎnshì fēnggé hé cáiliào.
examples.english: Real estate companies use model rooms to showcase styles and materials.

examples.chinese: 样板间里的家具可能与交付标准不同(樣板間裡的家具可能與交付標準不同)。
examples.pinyin: Yàngbǎnjiān lǐ de jiājù kěnéng yǔ jiāofù biāozhǔn bùtóng.
examples.english: The furniture in the showroom may differ from the delivery standard.
